review_title: One of th Worst Movie of ALL TIME
review_detailed_main: House of the Dead is positively one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I am a big horror movie fan and this was a real disappointment. If any one is reading this and thought Blair Witch 2 was the worst horror movie ever, guess again! Don't waste any money renting this movie! The plot revolves, much like the video game, around a group of young people traveling to a "cursed" island. When the group reaches the island they find that all the party-goers have dissapeared and soon find themselves fighting off the most poorly constructed zombies of all time. People watching this movie in 1950 would probably have complained about how lame the special effects are. The plot is worse than that of BW 2 and to top it all off the frequently flash to scenes, from the video game, of zombies being shot. The only thing scarier than this movie is the thought of having to watch it again.

It is hard to screw up a zombie flick but they do a great job of it here. Good acting is hardly needed but at least acting which doesn't look like it came out of a soap opera is required in order to not distract you from the bloodletting. Zombie film checklist:

T & A : 10/10 SFX: 6/10 (mostly guys in body suits)

Intercutting scenes from the video game throughout the film is just silly and the matrixesque cinematography is just plain lame in a zombie flick.

Better to rent "Day of the Dead" again then see this. If you must see it I recommend being stoned.

review_title: One of the worst movies ever made
review_detailed_main:
I have seen thousands of horror movies from the schlock shockers like Blood Feast to high quality fright fests like Haut Tension, but House Of The Dead is a slap in the face. Take 10 dollars from you wallet (what I paid in theaters) and use it as toilet paper and you get the same feeling as watching House Of The Dead. I saw this movie and I wish I could make Uwe Boll give me my time and money back! For the first half of the movie it's 30 year olds with no acting ability playing teenagers going to a rave in a remote island. And they all have sex, get high, and zombie kill them off screen. In the second half the survivors get guns and every scene is in slow motion and they show a 360-camera pan as soon a shot is fired. It starts ripping off the Matrix for the rest of the movie. They threw in some decent gore too late in the movie. Somehow despite the gore (very late in the movie) and the nudity it was a boring movie that is painful to watch. Al least Ed Wood's films were fun to make fun of. But this is no laughing matter.

Uwe Boll if you read this review I demand you refund us the money we wasted, and stop making movies for the good of humanity. After seeming this movie and reading about a sequel in the works I believe (jokingly) Uwe Boll is the Antichrist.

review_title: Textbook example of what not to do
review_detailed_main:
Uwe Boll has taken what could have been a great horror movie and turned it into a textbook example of how to create a truly atrocious licensed movie.

The writing in House of the Dead is so bad you will be rooting for the zombies, if for no other reason than they don't talk. The dialog varies between gratuitous and painful, with the occasional welcome sprinkle of unintelligible. Characters frequently exceed the normal stupidity found in most zombie movies, often deciding to run into the massive horde of undead instead of away from them. Of course, while the undead vary quite widely from the tree-leaping lupine zombies to the slow, lumbering, and kind-of-lost zombies, they are by far Hollywood's least threatening monsters. They are so weak they can be felled by a single bullet, and even lose several knife fights. Forget about smashing through walls, these zombies can't even push over small pieces of wood blocking windows.

OK, so the writing is atrocious, the plot is terrible, and the zombies are paper-thin. But at least there is a great, grand house like in the videogames, and is beautifully filmed to take maximum effect from each scene, right? Sadly, no. While in the videogames the house of the dead could easily be described as a mansion, here it is a tiny and run-down two-room affair... An outhouse of the dead, if you will. Even the now-infamous shots of the house spliced in from the videogames look more convincing. And yes, the movie makers do splice in shots from the video game. And every time a character dies they get a death animation stolen from Resident Evil. And they use the Matrix special effect about 30 times. Even if you discount these atrocious effects, the normal cinematography is still so bad Gilbert Godfried would be ashamed to show it on USA's Up All Night. The only visual effects that really worked were of the zombie's exploding heads, which while not terrifying were surprisingly satisfying.

We came into this fully expecting a bad movie, only to be surprised by the true depth this movie achieves. Characters throw up on each other. Zombies swim. People arrive at an empty rave full of blood-soaked clothing and immediately have sex. Within the first 30 minutes no fewer than six breasts had been exposed. Did I mention that zombies lose knife fights? If you're looking for a truly awful movie, look no further. This is it. This is the standard by which all bad movies will be judged in the future.

review_title: It is so bad that you can't even write a review bad enough to justify it
review_detailed_main: OK, I know that there are a million threads on this, but I couldn't resist. I consider myself to be a pretty big movie buff so I watched this movie last night. I knew that it would be bad. I am on this site every day and everyone talks about how bad this is. I, however, wanted to see it anyway for educational value. I see all of the top 250 movies as well as the bottom 100 movies just to see them. You can think what you want about that but that is besides the point. I like corny movies, I find them comical. I like zombie movies. With this in mind I thought that maybe I would enjoy this in a corny B movie kind of way. Boy was I way off. This is top 5 worst movies I have ever seen and I have seen a lot. This was so terrible I couldn't believe it. All of the reviews on here that I have read don't even give it justice. It is so bad that you can't even write a review bad enough to justify it. Everything that could go wrong in a movie has gone wrong here. The acting and story, or lack there of, were horrible. The Director should be shot. I know everyone hates Uwe Boll, but I ask how a man like this becomes a Director. I have no Director experience what so ever and I am positive that I can do better than this. I can not believe this was made. The best parts of the movie were the video game sequences (sarcasm). Who decided to throw those in? They should be banned from movies forever. I think that we should start McCarthyism all over again and black list anyone who had anything to do with this movie. To sum up in a few words: No matter how much you like to laugh at B Movies, this is too bad for even that kind of enjoyment. Stay away.

review_title: One film that actually made me angry...
review_detailed_main: This is 1 of 2 films in the history of film making that actually made me extremely angry!! (the other film is "The Cave" starring Cole Hauser. This film is SO bad that I would actually recommend you see it just to know for yourself! Okay, we all know the video game right? This movie as an absolute insult to the genre in film and video gaming. I cannot stress enough how disappointing EVERY aspect of this film is. NEVER us bullet-time camera work in a low-budget film!!!! EVER!!!! You know what? I am getting angry just typing this. So I will stop now. But, just know that "House of the Dead" should've been #1 in the bottom 100. That is all I can say....

House of the Dead was bad. Not bad ass. Just bad. They might as well have made a Pong movie... It was just horrid. There is no easy way to explain how bad this movie was. It was so bad that twice during the movie, the theater where I was at decided to stop the film by turning the houselights on... Perhaps just to see how many people were walking out... or perhaps just to help out those who were trying to leave... get out. Not only did the storyline bite chunky pancake dough... but the "actors" just weren't acting. The very first line in the movie kills it for everybody in the theater. You are NOT supposed to start a movie off by having a guy say "If only they wouldn't have come... they would still be alive"... You just don't say that. Sega... how could you? You've made absolute fools of yourselves (Sega seemed to have sponsored the "Rave of the Year" where this whole thing took place). And if you're going to make a movie based off a game.. please.. pleaaaaaaaaaase... don't use clips from the game within the movie. And if you're going to use bullet time... don't use it for more than a total minutes of 30 seconds in a fight scene. The only reason I can possibly think of for this movie being so insipidly stupid... was that they were trying to get the most mistakes for moviemistakes.com on opening weekend. One scene that really stood out was near the end. If you watch carefully, when the two 'survivors' are running out of the underground cave lab thing ... it's day... when the lab blows up a second later... it's night... when they show the two characters talking after that.. it's still night... but then when the evil dude comes running out after them.. it's day again. I've seen bad movies.. and I must say, this is the WORST movie I've ever seen. I knew something was wrong when the opening credits involved a Photoshop'ed (chopped? After Effects? nah.. most probably Videowave...) series of clips from the game itself. The only good thing about the entire movie were the boobie shots... and maybe the few little jokes that were "hidden" in the dialogue (dude to chick: "It looks like it's gonna rain.. we'd better get inside before we get wet" girl:"Too late...") Just.. don't watch it.. if you absolutely must watch a bad b-movie... watch House of a 1000 Corpses... atleast that one has a really nice execution scene. As I understand... Alone in the Dark is being made by this same company. Let's just hope it's not as bad as House of the Dead. And if everything goes well... we'll have a Silent Hill movie on our hands soon.

This movie was the most horrible film I've seen. I've seen bad movies before that "knew" that they were bad movies and that made them fun to watch. This movie was trying way too hard to be something that it simply was not.

The game that this movie was trying to adapt was more interesting even if you had to spend $20 in quarters to finish it. The storyline in it was better, and the graphics I'm sad to say were a lot better too. This does not help the game-to-film genre, if anything it hurts it more. Don't expect more from the next two movies that Uwe Boll is directing that are game adaptations (Alone in the Dark and Bloodrayne).

Bad script, bad acting, bad directing, horrible FX. Don't lose 90-minutes of your life like I did. Now I have to die knowing that I have 90-minutes less because of this piece of crap movie.

Thanks for nothing Uwe Boll.

review_title: One of the worst films ever made. And I'm being serious.
review_detailed_main:
So here I am, in my video store. What film do I feel like tonight? Hmm... a horror film sounds good. So, I'm looking around, and what's this? A House of the Dead movie?! Oh god! And one of the comments says, "The Dawn of the Dead meets The Matrix". Right, that's it, I'm buying this! This was the excited hysteria that followed me finding this movie. You see, I am a HUGE fan of The House Of The Dead video game. I didn't even know this movie existed. I also like old zombie movies. I also like the Matrix. However, unknowingly, I had made one the worst mistakes of my film watching life.

So, here I am, at home. I put the DVD in my player, and as the interactive menu appears, I hear the voice-over man from the original arcade game saying, "The House.... OF THE DEAD." A buzz of nostalgia washes over me. So, I press select, and the film starts playing. For the next 87 minutes, I was in a depressed, suicidal state.

How could they do this to a legendary game? Make it a pile of trash? How could I describe this movie in three words? How about this movie sucks. The "special" effects look like they've been thrown together by a confused four year old. I've seen acting superior acting to this in a porn film. The entire film is so frustratingly hard to understand, that you feel like tearing your hair out. The plot is one of the very worst I've encountered. The entire film is a crying shame. And would throwing in a bunch of clips from the game completely at random make it any better, even for a die hard House Of The Dead fan like me? No. In fact, it makes it even worse, seeing your favourite game reduced to nothing. The cast are complete unknowns, (sometimes, this can be to a films advantage, e.g 28 Days Later, Blair Witch Project, but it makes it worse here)it has zilch production values and the director (Uwe Boll) is well known for his trashy game to film conversions.

In fact, I've done a little research on Uwe Boll, and I've found this. He has made SEVEN game to film conversions. EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM IS CONSIDERED COMPLETE TRASH. And guess what? He's planning to make another three.

The message is clear: DON'T BUY THIS MOVIE. House Of The Dead fans, don't be tempted by the name. Watching this will only make your love of the game shrink.

review_title: A movie from the director that instills horror in gamers
review_detailed_main:
This movie is HORRIBLE!

The movie is based on a video-game series with the same name by SEGA, of which I have played House of the Dead II and III. Two games I would say are the some of the most fun to play light-gun games IF you have a light-gun to play them with (do not bother playing with gamepad, mouse or keyboard, trust me, I have tried). So despite the games having flaws such as bad graphics, minimalist story (there only for backdrop to the game), and really bad translations of the characters lines (f.ex. "Don't come!" when a girl is approached by a zombie), the lines are so bad some of them become really funny (unlike the movie). But amid all this the game was actually FUN to play, you know FUN? Like games are supposed to be. So a game is not like a movie, a game is supposed to be fun to play and does not need a story, it merely needs to be fun to play with, plots are unnecessary really.

I was genuinely surprised when I heard of this movie, since the game series it was based on had almost no story to speak of, I mean the basic plot from the game was just loosely this: (this is from the game, not the movie, so no spoilers, sorry) You, a type of investigator/cop (It's and your partner are sent out to some town, you see zombies, you save some people, evil scientist and later evil dictator-type makes zombies using green stuff, you save the day. End plot. I really did not think one could make a movie with so little to base it on, so I was exited to be able to see how it would come out...

I CAN NO LONGER PLAY THE GAME!!! Because it reminds me of the movie.

This movie was so.. horrible that it hurts trying to think about it.

The worst part is that I can not pinpoint what really made it so bad. The acting is mediocre, but i have loved films with worse acting. The scenery/props is/are nice and leaves no negative remarks visually (the style/condition of some of the props on tables remind me of Evil Dead for some reason). The location has NOTHING to do with the games. The characters are even less likable then the ones from the game. The plot is altered for the worse. And probably some other things I am currently suppressing from memory.

Conclusion: DO NOT WATCH, it will ruin your chance to enjoy the games.

You know, I like cheesy horror movies. I can fully enjoy a mindless bloodfest on a cool night. When I saw House of the Dead, I was wishing I was dead. The writing was awful, acting was even worse (The zombies acting wasn't bad though), and the use of the Matrix style filming was over done...and done badly. Any positive at all in this movie? Well, the zombies were cool, some good nudity, and some nice bloody effects. But in the end, this is one of the worse movies I have ever seen, which turn out to be a poor excuse for a long commercial for SEGA and the House of the Dead video games.

I don't know where to start... First there is the plot or lack of one. A rave party on an island being raided by zombies and the survivors must fight their way out. There is no story at all. No characters. You don't get to no much about these people. Who is the one main character this bad excuse for a movie is all about? I have no idea. You don't relate to them in any way. There is a voice over by a guy. The one guy you no less about. The one man you get to no most about is really the captain and he has nothing to do with it! It's not a good written story. The dialog is just silly and stupid.

Then there is the total lack of logic. The characters act total illogical in certain situation, and the situations them selves are weird as well. For instance, a bunch of rich teenagers that have never seen a fight and much less fired a weapon, suddenly becomes martial art masters and state of the art marksmen... The actors does a less good job and as for the directing... Uwe Boll does a great job in making this a horrible movie. Using clips from the computer game as transitions and short clips of monsters running in the forest. It's a nice try, but sorry it doesn't work! The music in it self is not so bad, but it just doesn't fit this movie and it contradicts the rest of the mood in the film. Not that there is much mood and atmosphere, though. It is not scary or tense or anything in any way. You don't get any feelings.

One thing I did kind of like was the lightning. This was at times good and there was a couple of nice shots, but over all the cinematography was nothing out of the ordinary. The special effects was also among the better things in this movie. It was, however, nothing extraordinary.

Now, why should you see this film? Well, you shouldn't. I mean it! This is one of those movies you just don't need to watch no matter how bored you are. The only excuse to watch it is if you are a die hard horror or video game made into film fan. Then you might consider it.

review_title: Movie so bad im typing this review while it plays...
review_detailed_main: Well...you know how when your a teenager and someone older warns you about a certain thing, then you go ahead and do it anyway and they look at you with that big smile and Say, "I TOLD YOU SO" well, Grin Imdb reviewers, I being of sound mind and body, and a devotee of Zombie films , chose to ignore the warnings, and boy am i sorry i did. Uwe boll, i hope you do more with your next two planned films especially for the sake of christian slater who is set to star in your next outing. The only analogy i could come up with for you releasing this film, is a 400 lb man eating 8 dominoes pizzas, 4 bags of cheetos, a tub of crisco and 10 lbs of chili, then running into the bathroom..and following a thunderous explosion, inviting the world in to see the remains! Keep it to yourself next time Uwe, i think the world would have negotiated and paid you NOT to release the movie..i know i would have shucked out 8 dollars instead of the 3.99 i paid to rent this horrid movie from hollywood video tonight by the way i will be returning it tomorrow first thing for my dollar credit for an early return Thank you Uwe for ruining my night!

review_title: Worst movie I have ever seen
review_detailed_main:
Back when this movie came out, I worked as a teen at a movie theatre and got to watch free movies all the time, so avid movie watcher here.

This is the only movie I have ever left from the movie theatre because it was so bad and couldn't stand to watch. This is the worst movie I have ever seen my whole life. Do not waste your time on this movie.

I tend to like a lot of movies and I am really not a hard critic, but this doesn't even fall into the "its so bad we should watch this because its bad" category, it actually made me angry to watch this. If you think "Well with all these bad reviews, I have to at least see how bad it was to know what I was missing" - No. DON'T do this to yourself.
